text: Bruce G. Blair (November 16, 1947 â€“ July 19, 2020) was an American nuclear security expert and a research scholar. He worked at the Program on Science and Global Security at Princeton University's Woodrow Wilson School of Public and International Affairs. His works focused on technical and policy steps on the path toward the elimination of nuclear weapons. He was co-founder of Global Zero. ==Death== Blair was born in Creston, Iowa. He died on July 19, 2020 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania from a stroke, aged 72. ==References== Category:1947 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American political writers Category:American political activists Category:Writers from Iowa Category:Educators from Illinois Category:People from Creston, Iowa Category:Princeton University faculty
title: Bruce G. Blair
